sen.j: 万里小路 博房（までのこうじ ひろふさ、文政7年6月25日 (旧暦)（1824年7月21日） - 明治17年（1884年）2月22日）は、江戸時代後期から明治時代にかけての公卿である。
sen.e: Hirofusa MADENOKOJI (born on June July 21, 1824 and passed away on February 22, 1884) was a Court noble from the late Edo period to the Meiji period.
Hirofusa MADENOKOJI (July 21, 1824 - February 22, 1884) was a Kugyo (court noble) from the late Edo Period to the Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: 生没年の表記を他のファイルと合わせました。
sen.e: Hirofusa MADENOKOJI (July 21, 1824 - February 22, 1884) was a Kugyo (court noble) from the late Edo Period to the Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 父は万里小路正房、母は藤波寛忠の娘。
sen.e: His father was Naofusa MADENOKOJI and his mother was Kanchu FUJINAMI's daughter.
His father was Naofusa MADENOKOJI and his mother was a daughter of Kanchu FUJINAMI.
sen.cmt: 「娘」の書き方を変更しました。
sen.e: His father was Naofusa MADENOKOJI and his mother was a daughter of Kanchu FUJINAMI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 夫人は森長義の十一女・貞子。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Sadako, Nagayoshi MORI's eleventh daughter.
sen.cmt: 森長義の読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Sadako, the eleventh daughter of Nagayoshi MORI.
sen.cmt: 森長義は「もりながよし」です。http://www1.parkcity.ne.jp/sito/270.html
sen.e: His lawful wife was Sadako, the eleventh daughter of Nagayoshi MORI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 子に万里小路通房、関博直、姉小路公義、河辺博長、千代子（裏松良光夫人）らがいる。
sen.e: His children were Michifusa MADENOKOJI, Hironao SEKI, Kimiyosi ANEKOJI, Hironaga KAWABE and Chiyoko (Yoshimitsu URAMATSU's wife).
sen.cmt: 関博直, 姉小路公義, 河辺博長, 裏松良光の読み方が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: His children were Michifusa MADENOKOJI, Hironao SEKI, Kintomo ANEKOJI, Hironaga KAWABE and Chiyoko (a wife of Yoshimitsu URAMATSU).
sen.cmt: 関博直：せきひろなおhttp://wapedia.mobi/ja/%E6%A3%AE%E6%B0%8F姉小路公義：あねこうじきんともhttp://www1.parkcity.ne.jp/sito/k15.html河辺博長：かわべひろなが（確認できる資料が見つかりませんでした。）裏松良光：うらまつよしみつ（確認できる資料が見つかりませんでした。）
sen.e: His children were Michifusa MADENOKOJI, Hironao SEKI, Kintomo ANEKOJI, Hironaga KAWABE and Chiyoko (a wife of Yoshimitsu URAMATSU).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文政9年（1826年）に叙爵、天保4年（1833年）に元服し従五位下に叙せられる。
sen.e: In 1826, Hirofusa was raised to the peerage, and in 1833 celebrated his coming of age and was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 1826, Hirofusa was conferred a peerage, and he was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1833 after he had his coming of age ceremony.
sen.cmt: 叙爵の書き方を他のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: In 1826, Hirofusa was conferred a peerage, and he was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1833 after he had his coming of age ceremony.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後、度々の位階の昇進を経て、慶応3年（1867年）に正四位下・蔵人頭に任ぜられる。
sen.e: After several promotions, in 1867, Hirofusa was appointed to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).
After several promotions, in 1867, Hirofusa was appointed to Shoshiinoge Kurodo no To (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade, Head Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 官位の表記を他のファイルと合わせました。
sen.e: After several promotions, in 1867, Hirofusa was appointed to Shoshiinoge Kurodo no To (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade, Head Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、同年11月4日には参議となり、同年12月9日の小御所会議に参加した。
sen.e: On November 4, 1867, he was appointed to Sangi (Councillor) and attended Kogosho Conference (the meeting held in the presence of the Emperor in the Kogosho Conference Room of Kyoto Imperial Palace) held on December 9, 1867.
sen.cmt: 用語集を参照しても、参議と次セルの参与の英訳の差異を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: On November 29 the same year, he was appointed to Sangi (Councilor) and attended Kogosho Conference (the meeting held in the presence of the Emperor in the Kogosho Conference Room of Kyoto Imperial Palace) held on January 3, 1868.
sen.cmt: 慶応3年11月4日は西暦1867年11月29日、慶応3年12月9日は西暦1868年1月3日です。
sen.e: On November 29 the same year, he was appointed to Sangi (Councilor) and attended Kogosho Conference (the meeting held in the presence of the Emperor in the Kogosho Conference Room of Kyoto Imperial Palace) held on January 3, 1868.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そこで参与に任ぜられ、翌年2月19日まで同職を務めた。
sen.e: At the conference, he was appointed to Sanyo (Councilor) and worked as Sanyo until February 10, 1868.
sen.cmt: 用語集を参照しても、前セルの参議と参与の英訳の差異を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: At the conference, he was appointed to Sanyo (Councilor) and remained in the post until March 12, 1868.
sen.cmt: 慶応4年2月19日は西暦1868年3月12日です。
sen.e: At the conference, he was appointed to Sanyo (Councilor) and remained in the post until March 12, 1868.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）に従三位・権中納言に叙任。
sen.e: In 1868, he was appointed to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
In 1868, he was appointed to Jusanmi Gon Chunagon (Junior Third Rank, Provisional Vice-councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 官位の補足説明を変更しました。
sen.e: In 1868, he was appointed to Jusanmi Gon Chunagon (Junior Third Rank, Provisional Vice-councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後は京都裁判所 (地方制度)総督、宮内省明治初期（1869年-1885年）、皇太后宮職などを務めた。
sen.e: Afterwards, in the early Meiji Period, Hirofusa worked as Kyoto Court Director General (the local system) and for Imperial Household Ministry and Kotaigogushoku (Imperial Household Agency employee assigned to the household of Queen Mother), and so forth.
sen.cmt: B欄に「宮内省明治初期」とありますが「明治初期に、京都裁判所・・・務めた」としました。また、次セルで1884年に死去とありますので、（1869年-1885年）は割愛しています。
sen.e: Later, Hirofusa worked as Kyoto Court Director General (one of the Japanese municipal system), Kotaigogushoku (Imperial Household Agency employee assigned to the household of Queen Mother) of Imperial Household Ministry in the early Meiji Period before the new cabinet system was introduced, and so forth.
sen.cmt: 地方制度は「日本の地方自治制度の一つ」と解釈して英文を変更しました。「宮内省明治初期」は内閣が設置される前後を区別する意図で記載されていると思われます。英文を書き換えました。また、「宮内省・・・」は「明治初期の宮内省の役職である皇太后宮職」と解釈しています。参照：http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%AE%AE%E5%86%85%E7%9C%81#.E6.98.8E.E6.B2.BB.E5.88.9D.E6.9C.9F.EF.BC.881869.E5.B9.B4-1885.E5.B9.B4.EF.BC.89
sen.e: Later, Hirofusa worked as Kyoto Court Director General (one of the Japanese municipal system), Kotaigogushoku (Imperial Household Agency employee assigned to the household of Queen Mother) of Imperial Household Ministry in the early Meiji Period before the new cabinet system was introduced, and so forth.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: In 1884, Hirofusa passed away at the age of 61.
Hirofusa died at the age of 61 in 1884.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Hirofusa died at the age of 61 in 1884.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、博房の死去から約5ヵ月後の7月7日、子の通房に伯爵が叙爵され、万里小路家は華族に列した。
sen.e: On July 7, approximately five months after Hirofusa's death, his son, Michifusa, was raised to a count; the Madenokoji family was raised to the peerage.
On July 7, about five months after Hirofusa's death, his son, Michifusa, was conferred count; the Madenokoji family joined the peerage.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: On July 7, about five months after Hirofusa's death, his son, Michifusa, was conferred count; the Madenokoji family joined the peerage.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
